post_text: Yesterday, March 23, 2020, the Governor of Pennsylvania extended the statewide school closure to at least April 6, 2020 for staff members and April 9th for students. The Montoursville Area School District is prepared to have our students reconnected with our staff starting Monday, March 30th. While there are many obstacles, we are all confident that we will be able to offer the best educationally enriching programs available. Teachers will have “virtual” office hours from 8:00am to 3:30pm every Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. The goal is be able to communicate with your children in whatever format necessary to ensure their continued success. We look foward to "seeing" you again soon!!!

We are working with police to follow up on the alleged threat made against our high school. Based on our communication with student’s and law enforcement, we are confident that the alleged threat was a rumor stemming from high school students talking in the hallways. We have found no credible evidence of future harm and have found no one person responsible.

We will continue to exercise extreme diligence and have taken appropriate measures to maintain a safe learning environment for our students.

We ask for your support in the following ways:
• Talk frequently with your children about what they are hearing and
experiencing during their school day.
• Encourage your children to report any suspicious activity to a trusted adult at
school or to you.
• Discuss the serious nature of starting rumors, especially on social media.

It is an honor to have the opportunity to educate your children. We appreciate your support and assistance in keeping our schools safe for everyone. Thank you.

At approximately 7:55 A.M. this morning a natural gas leak was detected in the Family Consumer Science Room at McCall Middle School. We immediately evacuated the students to Faith United Methodist Church.

We called 911. The emergency response team as well as the gas company was dispatched to the middle school. Upon thorough inspection by the gas company, our district maintenance department, and the emergency team, we were cleared to re-enter the school.

The students were very attentive and cooperative throughout the entire drill. The McCall and Faith United Methodist Church Staff were very helpful.

Everyone was back in the school by 8:55 A.M. There were no injuries.

The district did sent out a parent link message, however, it was just sent out to primary phones only. Future messages will be sent out to all phones, text and emails.
